data.title: Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention
data.meta_description: Review the following information to access contacts, funding information, state plans, performance measures, and more.
data.meta_site_name: Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention
data.text:
The OJJDP Title II Formula Grants Program provides funding to support state and local efforts to plan, establish, operate, coordinate, and evaluate policies and projects, directly or through grants and contracts with public and private agencies, for the development of more effective education, training, research, prevention, diversion, treatment, and rehabilitation programs, as well as justice system improvement efforts.

The Formula Grants Program is authorized under the JJDP Act of 1974, as amended, at 34 U.S.C. ยง 11131-11133. Pursuant to Part B of Title II of the JJDP Act, to receive formula grants, states must submit a plan for carrying out Formula Grants Program activities applicable to a 3-year period.

Title II Formula Grant Eligibility: Participating State in Fiscal Year 2020

Distribution of Formula Grants for Fiscal Year 2020

FY 2020 Prison Rape Elimination (PREA) Award Amount$0FY 2020 Formula Grant Award Level$1,421,634 Non-Compliance Reduction$0 State Award Level Less Non-Compliance$1,421,634 Less PREA Reduction$0 Redistributed PREA Funds$1,479 FY 2020 Title II Allocations$1,423,113 PREA Abeyance Distribution$0 FY 2015 Non-Compliance Distribution (AS)$2,722 FY 2016 Non-Compliance Distribution (AS)$3,147 FY 2017 Non-Compliance Distribution (GU)$2,692 FY 2018 Non-Compliance Distribution (TX/WV)$140,171 FY 2019 Non-Compliance Distribution (AS/ID/MA/MP/OK/SC/TX/WI/WV)$196,560 PREA FY 2018 Prior Year Redistribution$0Total FY 2020 Title II Allocations$1,768,405FY 2020 Estimates for the Native American Pass-through Amount$0
